Reviews.Title: “Fair hotel, difficult location”
Reviews.Author: Howard4
Reviews.Content: After a 4 1/2 hr., uneventful, drive from Philadelphia area, it took 3 "turnarounds" through small streets, a trucking distribution center, a highway, and heavy traffic to find the place--and that was in daylight with a GPS!!! Hotel itself is just OK at best. Staff was friendly. Included breakfast not so good. The hotel sits in what seems to be a trucking distribution center near South Boston, 1.7 miles from Faneuil Hall. Parking spaces were always filled except for the rear of the hotel--with some random people walking around and tractor-trailors parked there as well. Even after the daylight experience, coming back to the hotel (from a different direction) again included a "turnaround" due to a missed turn. I am not directionally challenged; it's just that this hotel is difficult to get in and out of. $133 AAA rate. Not cheap, but less expensive than most hotels in Boston. Old addage, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Good, nice, inexpensive Holiday Inn near Logan airport”
Reviews.Author: petervee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I had a flight early in the morning and had to be near Logan airport. The hotel offers nice rooms, nice breakfast and is much closer to Logan airport than a map shows. It took me just 10 minutes to drive there, sign posted all the way. The area may not be the best but as an airport hotel it is excellent. Rooms are nice and big. There is free parking behind the hotel (also unusual compared to other Boston hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Find something else!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandCandiO
Reviews.Content: I had to book a last minute hotel in Boston and this one was available. I trusted it because of the reputible name of Holiday Inn and the continental breakfast in a pricey city like Boston. Upon my check in I noticed a moldy stain about 12 inches in diameter on the ceiling. I asked for a new room and was kindly given one. However, the next room had loose tiles on the bathroom floor and hair on the wall. As the night went on I learned how paper thin the walls were and each time we rode the elevator we thought it wasnt going to make it. Honestly, it took three times of a typical elevator ride and made quite a bit of noise. The staff was very nice, valet was great but the environment and location were not great at all. I recommend finding another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: Raymond W
Reviews.Content: Great Friendly service. Coffee could have been fresher in the morning. Check in and check out were easy. Getting in and out of the parking lot is a little challenging.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in Boston with free parking”
Reviews.Author: Mrjamie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days just to see the sights, and wanted a place to park that was included. If you are looking for 4 - 5 star fancy, and the Ritz, this is not the place for you. But if you want a clean, safe place for a short stay. Consider this hotel. By the way, I am reviewing the one on 69 Boston St. as I believe there are several. Here are some values: Free parking so you can come and go. Free shuttle to Metro (subway) Full breakfast with attentive and helpful staff. It was not a menu - cooked to order, but we found it way ahead of typical "continental breakfasts" Quick elevators; push the button and the door opens (some require a long wait) Best of all: the staff is genuinely helpful and seemed concerned that guests enjoy not just survive. I'm not used to stopping at the desk each morning to greet workers on duty, but they went the extra mile to be helpful. I'd rather have this than stay at a fancy place where the people are starchy or artificial in their friendliness. The room was clean; heat worked quickly and quietly (Feb.) For those who have read grumpy reports about this place, we really wonder what they are talking about. We were impressed. Example; we had a small leak in the minivan radiator; nothing serious but I needed to add some water one morning. The hotel manager Dennis was passing by and he said "If you need anything or there is any way we can help, please don't hesitate to ask." Finally, there price was about average for the city - or perhaps a little better; but when you figure in free parking, it was a good buy. By the way, there was a small refrigerator and a mincrowave oven in the room; next property was a small strip mall with a Panera Bread restaurant (excellent) and an Olive Garden (fair - not impressed)

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: laura0299
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for the park and fly promotion which was good, although I was nervous my car wouldn't be there when we returned, or broken into. Our room was really run down and gross. The bathroom door lock was broken off the door so it wouldn't lock, moldy shower curtain, gross floor, and water damage around the tub and floor so there was little holes into the wall everywhere. I didn't feel clean and was nervous to take my shoes off. Wouldn't stay here again, and wouldn't recommend it to anyone, tons of other great clean safe places to stay in the city!

Reviews.Title: “A good HIE”
Reviews.Author: Tauwhare
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Sept '10 for 2 nights. Very good hotel, great location, great breakfast, great room - very spacious). Most of the reception staff very friendly and helpful - with one exception. I'm sure it would be the same person mentioned by Kathy C. We were charged for several shuttle trips that we didn't take and when we challenged them on our bill, she threw a real wobbly. But you don't let one person spoil what was otherwise a very enjoyable stay. HIE hotels are a great choice and we won't let her stop us from using the chain again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most HIE - Recently rennovated”
Reviews.Author: P4620
Reviews.Content: I was here 1 night for business. The hotel has been recently upgraded and provides good value compared to other similar type properties. Just a few miles outside of downtown Boston right off of 93 (on the south side). Convenient to Boston and Logan airport. the hotel is right near a shopping center that has an applebees and an Olive garden as well as a target and best buy. The hotel has free parking and free internet that is faster/more reliable than a lot of hotels I have stayed at. The room was on the small side but I would say normal size for boston (I had a 1 bed queen room). My room was quiet with power outlets near the bed and at the desk. There was a nice flat screen TV with tons of channels (including HD), a fridge, microwave and a workdesk/chair. The bathroom is small but plenty of hot water. The bed was comfortable but like most HIE the pillows were small (a minor convenience). The linens/towels were clean and in good shape and in general the entire hotel was very clean. The front desk was staff was very nice/pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Warning - UNRELIABLE, Desk Clerk Should get FIRED!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy C
Reviews.Content: The Desk clerk was a Big B-- / pain. She had to work a double and took it out on my family, Slooow and when I asked for the manager she then cancelled my reservation. Left us without a room and couldn't care less. I dealt with Holiday Inn for 30 years and will never stay at another. How can you cancel a paid in advance guaranteed room. Went to the Best Western and had a nice weekend anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Better than staying downtown if you have a car or don't mind a short cab ride”
Reviews.Author: semi-pro-traveller
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive, clean, service, near airport, free parking. Recognized Platinum status with upgrade and gift. Will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “In the thick of things...”
Reviews.Author: dickinsons94
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is adjacent to the TD Banknorth Center (North Station). The online rate was better than the actual reservation rate over the telephone and the reservation specialist was honest about it. The lobby looks fabulous and the complimentary breakfast was out of this world good. The staff was very welcoming on all shifts. DOWNSIDE: There was a washcloth left in our bathtub with personal hair on it. The temperature of the room was hot, uncomfortable and not controllable by us (we stayed 12/23 so it was cold out). When I told the front desk about it the next day, they offered the suggestion to put the heat on economy and leave the windows open...

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel for average prices”
Reviews.Author: Hotspur91
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was cheap compared to other hotels in Boston. This is due to the fact that it is quite far from the centre but we are from London so were happy enough to walk to the Subway station and use public transport to move around. The parking and wifi were free which was good as was the breakfast. Breakfast was sufficient but I wouldn't have paid for it. It would be good to have more than one type of tea and American orange juice always seems to be watery, sugary, orange flavoured drink rather than orange juice. Staff could be a bit surly but generally were ok. The room was tired but large and ok for our purposes as we didn't spend much time in the room. The bathroom smelt a little damp. Overall, I wouldn't go out my way to recommend this place to a friend but if it is a lot cheaper than anywhere else, I would tell them that you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: dialafa
Reviews.Content: Clean, easy, above average continental breakfast, and great rooms/beds. In Cambridge, but Boston is such a walkable city that it's close to everything. Also, close to the metro and public transportation. Across the street is a market so it's great if you want to save money since the Holiday Inn has a mini fridge and a microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Mass. Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeBob
Reviews.Content: October 20,2011. We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express at 69 Boston St. on the Southside of Boston. We were to leave the next day for a cruise. The staff at the front desk Carol,Gina.and Sahahi were very friendly and helpful in all of our request. A full morning breakfast. A shuttle service was provided from the airport to hotel and from the hotel to the cruise ship. A small fee of $10. bucks covered it. My next trip to Boston will be with these people.We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good”
Reviews.Author: chris036
Reviews.Content: Booked on the strength of reviews I found this Holiday Inn to be ok only. Staff were a bit distant, as is the location - although they provide a free shuttle to Andrew metro station, which is actually only 8mins walk away anyway. Town isn't too far, but it does take up time so bear it in mind. Rooms a little tired, lifts old and slow, but free breakfast, wifi, coffee all make it value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to reach and close to Boston city and Logan airport”
Reviews.Author: YvonneBrussels
Reviews.Content: It was easy to find the hotel using the rented GPS in our rental car. Please be aware that you have to pay immediately about 4 dollars for the tunnel, driving from the airport (island) so make sure to have some cash. The parking is free at the hotel. The Andrew metro station is a 7 minutes walk, a ticket 2 dollar per ride and easy to buy from a Charley ticket machine in the station, cash or Visa. If you buy more rides at once the price of a Charley ticket is 1,70 dolar. The metro is the best way to get to town because downtown parking fees can go up to 35 dollar per day. The Park street metro stop is a good start for the Freedom trail and for the Beacon hill area (with the Cheers bar on Beacon street from the tv series Cheers). A taxi from the hotel to downtown might cost about 20 dollar. The hotel is basic but good, and breakfast is included, very convenient. The staff was helpful in explaining where to go as a tourist. Free WIFI in the hotel and computers in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “boston good for me”
Reviews.Author: denmar186338
Reviews.Content: seen some off the reviews This is good value i thought my room was clean good wet room Breakfast was good enough staff were always busy but helpful &their tube is easy to work out & easy access to walk too or take shuttle at the back their is some good cheap stores to take gifts back to London Good place

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE MAKES UP FOR LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: showmetraveler
Reviews.Content: It's true that this hotel is a little distant from the tourist area of Boston, but the staff and amenities more than make up for any inconvenience. The hotel's shuttle will pick you up from and return you to Logan for $5 pp 24/7. The shuttle will also take you to and return you from the nearby Andrew subway station for a quick ride downtown. All of the local tour companies pickup and return to this hotel. Free internet, free breakfast. GREAT front desk staff. And it's $100 per night cheaper than downtown hotels that don't offer anywhere near the service. It would be great if all the sights were just out the front door like at the Parker House, but we felt the trade-off was more than worth it.

Reviews.Title: “nice staff”
Reviews.Author: gweaffer
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights prior to travelling to New York. Hotel was booked for us as part of a package.Breakfast was OK. Staff where polite and helpful. Hotel quite dated could do with a up grade

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel, but enthusiastic staff...”
Reviews.Author: gary7272
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I stayed for two nights at the HIE. It is not the easiest place to find in the southern part of Boston...Be sure to have a GPS or great directions...The hotel is quite tired looking, but adequate for our purposes. The location is within 10 minutes of a T station that will take you almost anywhere in Boston. It is behind a shopping center with a Target, TJ Max,etc...Panera's, Applebees... The parking was free which was a great plus. The rooms seemed dated as did the entire complex. The parking lot was being worked on, so at times we had to move cones to get out of the lot. The breakfast was quite mediocre. Nevertheless, the staff was quite helpful and knowledgeable, especiallly the front desk people who were extremely enthusiastic. It was generically overpriced, but somewhat reasonable for Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vasnos
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two days prior to our cruise. Great accomidations and good breakfast. Shuttle brought us to cruise terminal.Needs a little cosmetic work, but they were working on some of that while we were there. i would recommend the Holiday in Express, Boston.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ellieque
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nothing special but we were only there for a couple of nights. Damp smell and room was pretty small. Hotels in Boston are way overpriced, so worth it to stay a little way out. Breakfast was included and was fine. We got the shuttle to and from the airport which was good value. The T station is only about 10 mins stroll and you can get downtown in a few minutes. We got cabs back at night though. The staff were friendly and sociable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: K C
Reviews.Content: Carol, Sarahi, Gina & Antwann were the best!!! Arrived August 25th 11:45 pm, shuttle picked us up within 20 minutes ($5 fee each way). Check-in was easy! Rooms are a little small and have a stench carpet odor! Nothing a little glade solid air freshener couldn't fix (which I grabbed at the local target in the strip mall right behind the hotel) :) Hotel is in a pretty good location.... A few minutes (walking) to the subway station...& they provide free shuttle within a certain radius! Continental breakfast is complimentary, not bad.... Late night complimentary cookies were GREAT! Especially fresh out the oven... ummm ummm If the rates are lower than $149 a night, will stay here again! If not, I'll take my chances on higher rates and stay a little closer to downtown. Add the taxi fare(s) to the bill and it'll average out. PS. This staff will go the extra mile to ensure your stay is as pleasant as they can make it. I really appreciate the extra attention and personal conversation. Oh yeah, and my most humble appreciation for allowing us to leave our belongings in the room past check out while we hung out at Fenway Park! :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Don't judge it by the Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: BigTimeLeafsFan
Reviews.Content: Great room, great staff and great breakfast included. This place had everything going for it. Even though it's next to the freeway, with planes flying by, we didn't seem to hear much of that and slept well. The neighborhood could use some fixing up, but the people all seemed friendly enough. Less than a 10 minute walk straight up the street to the subway, getting on the "T" at "Andrew." We asked for directions and got lots of help. I'd stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A super little place - staff were so helpful”
Reviews.Author: gak2705
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were stuck when our flight was cancelled because of hurricane Irene. The staff in the hotel were so helpful and friendly they made sure we were able to contact our airline etc. It has a great a location (backing onto a retail park with many goood stores). It is close to the metro and easy to find. Breakfast was good and plentiful and the warm cookies a treat in the evening. $5 transportation to the airport and the site seeing trolley stops every morning. A good little find

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled reservation due to hurricane Irene”
Reviews.Author: Linnea S
Reviews.Content: Had advance reservations for night of 8/27. Even though there is a no refund policy, due to impending Hurricane Irene did not charge for cancellation. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION... VERY HELPFUL STAFF- CLOSE ANDREW SUBWAY”
Reviews.Author: CHICAGO049
Reviews.Content: Picked up at Airport within 20 Min.... This Hotel is Close to Andrew Red Line Subway Station a 10 min walk. Desk personnel very helpful and Informative, Rooms were clean. South Bay Shopping Center right behind Hotel..Target-Best Buy- TJ Max -Marshalls Try 224 Restaurant about 10 min walk west on Boston Street. Excellent food menu... also 3 restaurants in shopping center.. Only negative things I will say is parking fills up very fast, and Breakfast room is small so at times must wait for a table.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, helpful staff and easy to get to downtown”
Reviews.Author: Rita k K
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nighst in mid August. The room was clean, breakfast was decent. We walked to the subway (approx 6 min) and rode to downtown in 30 minutes. We took the train to Fenway and the Aquarium. The hotel isn't an upscale area, but we had no issues. Target, TJ MAX, Marshall's,Applebees, and a grocery store and Best Buy,and more are in the South Bay mall right behind the hotel. The staff was so nice. The shuttle drove us to the train station the first day so we could see how to get there! After that we walked as we needed the exercise. Did the harbour cruise twice, one to see the harbour and the other to go to see Fort Warren on one of the islands. A fun day trip. Of course seeing Boston vs the Yankees was the highlight for us! Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, decent location”
Reviews.Author: SoumitreeG
Reviews.Content: Was on a short business trip and hence chose this hotel because of the good price offers. On the side of a main highway, hence nothing much in the immediate vicinity (like shops, entertainment centers, etc), but it just a 10 min cab ride away from the city center and the marina/ docks, etc. The staff at the reception counter are very helpful, but wish the same could be said for the staff in charge of the morning breakfast - they were very rude and surly. rooms were nice and decent. fairly big, clean, nice clean toilet/ bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “It is an overall best option in consideration of convenience and cost”
Reviews.Author: Tea2gather
Reviews.Content: We know it is not a luxury option option. Everything is just ordinary . The queen bed room we have is very small, but at least is clean. The hotel just finish renovation inside so it smells very fresh. We still like it because it is 5 -10 min walking distance from Andrew subway even though the route is not on highly traffic area. There is a south bay shopping centre right behind the hotel with target, best buy, and Marshall. We do not have to pay extra for parking. One down side is you can hear noise from next door even though we ask for quiet floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Not-so-great hotel”
Reviews.Author: babsy sue
Reviews.Content: One main reason we chose this hotel was that it is very convenient to everything - and it certainly is - and there is free parking. However, this hotel states it was renovated in February 2011; but when we arrived in July 2011, the renovation was still taking place. We went without cable for a night and half a day while it was being upgraded without being advised beforehand. Our room, one double bed, was very tiny for two people but it was clean. The parking was filled very quickly, and one night we had to park in the next-door hotel's lot. The breakfast bar didn't have a microwave, so I couldn't get oatmeal (I could have made it in my room as there was a microwave there; but I didn't bring any with me). There was no hotel book in the room for reference, and the people at the front desk seemed very disinterested. We paid for our stay with Priority Club reward points; and I believe 25,000 per night was too many points for what we received.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and safe”
Reviews.Author: AbuDhabiWil
Reviews.Content: Great value for a decent HI Express in pricey Boston. Ample parking lots and clean rooms. Great warm breakfast in the morning. Close proximity to the metro. Would definitely choose this hotel when we are back in New England!

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle no longer”
Reviews.Author: PickmePlease
Reviews.Content: As of a day before our trip we had called and inquired about the shuttle to make sure it still went downtown in which we were told yes , and when we arrived they said it no longer did. This was a HUGE disappointment as we were traveling with young children. I did not feel the safest in this area, especially walking to the subway with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY FAMILY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Aussietez
Reviews.Content: This hotel does the simply things well. It is very clean and the 2 double rooms are very adequately sized and fitted out for a family of 4. Breakfast was included in the room tariff and the food was better than average. The best part of the hotel however were the two ladies at the reception desk. They were both excellent and couldn't do enough for you. From early check-in, to recommending things to do whilst in Boston. The neighbourhood the property is in is just ok. Not the most aesthetically pleasing but by no means a deal breaker. We walked to the nearest subway each day (about 12 minute walk) and felt very safe during the day. It was then about another 15 minutes on the subway to get into Boston City. Ample free parking on-site. Limited dining choices in neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Traveler802
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Last Miinute Travel for a bargain rate of $99/night. I was pleasantly surprised to find clean, very adequate rooms and rate included a full breakfast in the morning. There is a shuttle to the airport for only $5 and the hotel is within walking distance to the T. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again....great location out of the city with easy access to the city!

Reviews.Title: “Quick business trip”
Reviews.Author: superdeejayanna
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the best value I could find for my last business trip to Boston. It has free parking, which is awesome if you bring a car. No, the neighborhood is not cute, but it's centrally located, close to the highway and perfect for what I needed. The staff were friendly and helpful. The free newlywed was just okay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: songbird1329
Reviews.Content: We had a short stay in Boston and wanted something convenient and relatively inexpensive. This place fit the bill and I would not hesitate to stay here again. Love that the entire hotel is non smoking. The shuttle to mass transit was a nice extra. Our room was clean and comfortable ... but relatively small ( we chose a room with one queen bed). The hotel was in the middle of renovations when we stayed so parking was at a premium. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but "ok"”
Reviews.Author: scooter44
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on the way back from a trip up the coast to Maine. While they have made a good effort at refreshing the decor and updating the amenities, you could tell that structurally it was a bit "iffy". We stayed in room 401, directly across from the elevator. It was VERY noisy with the elevator pinging all evening and the conversations that take place while waiting for elevator. They elevator cables are also in serious need of some WD40 as they squeak and squeal on the way up and down ALL NIGHT. I think they may have scrimped on the door quality for the rooms as I could hear everything going on out there. This could be just that room but I don't know. The room was overall comfortable however - the decor was nice, shower and bathroom clean and nice, and the kitchenette was great. The continental breakfast was fine also. Right next to Boston Garden so probably ideal for a game night.

Reviews.Title: “not bad!!!”
Reviews.Author: midgetwarrior
Reviews.Content: Staff was helpful when asking questions or directions.... hotel was in walking distance to the train OR if you want to wait for the shuttle, you can. Its about a 10-15min walk to the train. Only saw the shuttle a few times... it was faster to just walk most times..(only rode in the shuttle once during our entire stay and we were back and forth to the train a lot) No pool in the hotel.. BUT there are beaches if you drive to the Quincy (shore drive) area or by Castle Island (which was really crowded). Room was new, and clean.... hallway carpet smelled like new car smell (wtf? Haha) flatscreen tv, fridge so new the door didnt open, microwave, ice machine by the elevators, wifi throughout the hotel (we were on 5th floor and i got perfect service no problem), vending machine downstairs in lobby.. Free breakfast til I think 11?... cereal, cinnabon (awesome), yogurt and other stuff like eggs, sausage (meh), bagels. Checkout is 12 I believe. Free parking for the duration of your stay. 15-20mins to the city via the T. Simple transportation system. Can't get lost. Would def. stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Unforgetable Experience”
Reviews.Author: Rita147319
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to Boston for a wedding and we had to stay at the wedding's hotel (H--tt). After the wedding we moved to the Holiday Inn Express, because the other one was too expensive and had no dinners nearby, so we had to do all of our meals there. The Holiday Inn was and unforgetable experience. I considerate it as a family hotel. The front desk ladies were very friendly and helpful throughout all of the different shifts. The room had a refrigerator, a microwave and a coffe maker all for free (the other one charged you for every item).The roomn was extremly cleaned and it smelled like they had changed the carpets recently for new ones. It served full breakfast daily also for free. It has a shuttle bus to and from the airport for a very small fee, compare to a taxi that charged you 5 times that fee. The location is also very convenient. It is near the subway, which it takes you to all the tourist and historical places. It has a mall walking distance with a huge grocery store. We could also do our plane check in because it has access to computers with free internet and printer. We spent the 4th of July sitting in front of our room window (which faced the city) watching the fireworks display, while listening to the music concert on the TV. What a nice way to celebrate the Independence Day!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: CTgirl77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite with my 2 sons over the 4th of July holiday. We chose the place because we thought it was a good value. Big mistake. Our room was filthy. I didn't even want to put our suitcase on the floor because the carpet was so dirty. The room was also very dark (which was probably a good thing, considering how dirty it was). We stayed on the 3rd floor and the elevator was out of service. Not a great neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for St. Paddy's Day!”
Reviews.Author: RyanD36
Reviews.Content: A few friends and I stayed here for a couple of nights for St. Patrick's Day. It isn't in the nicest part of town, but it is near the subway and the airport. It isn't near downtown, but it is much cheaper than hotels in the downtown area, and it is easy to get there with just a subway ride. The staff were very friendly, and had no problems with us being loud and having multiple people in our rooms (maybe they are not so nice if it isn't St. Patrick's Day). Internet worked great and was free, and rooms were clean. The continental breakfast was sufficient - the cereal and fruits were good, the hot food they had out wasn't great. Overall, a good place to stay for a few days to see Boston and party with some friends, while saving some money.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations in every single way, and I don't mean good.”
Reviews.Author: diva_enroute
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived at this hotel, I knew what I was in for. They are currently renovating the outside of the building and so the main door was not available. Guests are asked to go through a side door which isn't automatic which made it really difficult to drag a large luggage through while struggling to hold the door open. I arrived at the front desk and no one greeted me, the lobby was a ghost town. Granted it was 1230am that I arrived but nonetheless you'd expect there to be front staff. I called out and didn't get a response and finally saw the maintenance person. He then had to find the front desk guy. The front desk guy was friendly enough but not very helpful. After he signed in, he told me to have a good stay but he hadn't given me a key. So I had to ask for it. Then I asked if there was a shuttle to the convention centre. He promptly replied "Yes" but that was it. I had to follow up with additional questions to find out schedule details. The rooms are newly renovated which I think is the only thing it has going for it, but the room had a very strong paint smell which was overwhelming. Overall the room was small but there wasn't a lot of furniture so it was well laid out. The washroom wasn't clean, I found stray hairs in the shower. Additionally the remote control was not "sanitized" as it typically is these days at nicer hotels. There is, however, free WIFI. The bed was soft and a bit saggy. It is a Holiday Inn Express which I guess is your bare basic type of accommodation but the price point I didn't find particularly "basic" at $160/night. Would I come back to this chain? Not likely if it was on my own coin, but I'm on business and there's a "guideline" as to which hotels are acceptable. So I'm guessing I may see another HI Express in my future - hopefully it will be better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Travelinf00l
Reviews.Content: This wasn't anything fancy but it was very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. They have a very nice breakfast in the morning, it is adjacent to a large shopping center with restaurants within walking distance. The Beantown trolley picks up in the morning and has a very nice tour of Boston, and will bring you back at the end of the day. The hotel has a luggage room to store your luggage if you need it. And we could reserve the shuttle to take us to the cruise ship in the afternoon. So convenient! We enjoyed our stay and I would definately recommend this to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a long Boston Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Hjk131
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our Boston trip. Free parking, free breakfast, and a short walk to the Andrew line (Subway) to get downtown. The subways were very easy to use. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. I would stay here again and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Economical place to stay in Boston, but seemed a bit tired.”
Reviews.Author: kak531
Reviews.Content: Definitely an economical place to stay, less than half the price of major DT Boston hotels. However, it seems to be an older HI, and could use a renovation. B-fast was better than avg. Overall an OK stay, just not special in any way other than price.

Reviews.Title: “Used Park Sleep Fly to book hotel.”
Reviews.Author: vrichard65
Reviews.Content: I used ParkSleepFly to book hotel. This is the only way they allow it if you want to park while you travel. The ParkSleepFly service never booked the hotel room. When we went to check in, there were no rooms available. I had to wait about an hour until some group that was missing a person was willing to give up a room that we could have. The shuttle service was ok. A little slow on the way back. I would never use the ParkSleepFly service again! The customer service person at the Holiday Inn Express said this service often doesn't book the hotel room. The floor we were on was loud until late. Some kids in the hall making a lot of noise. Very Disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BexleyStuart
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights with our 2 year old son for a city break. From the outside it looks pretty run down (as it is undergoing renovations) - but inside was clean and the customer service really good. The complimentary breakfast was great - although the dining area got pretty busy. Although not in the city centre - we used the nearby T station at Andrew a lot - it took about 10 mins to get to downtown. Area felt safe to walk around - and there's a good retail park next door with a supermarket, Appleby's etc. With so many Boston hotels really expensive, this place was a good low cost alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and price - but we are easy to please”
Reviews.Author: mustie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here for the second time and will stay again when we are in Boston. The reason of our stay is that I come out to run the Boston marathon each April. When vacationing we always try to find the biggest bang for our buck - and the Holiday Inn Express at 69 Boston Street has just that! The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff is friendly and accomodating - very helpful with getting us around Boston. The location is just a short walk from the subway and only a few stops out from downtown Boston. The continental breakfast is delicous and there is something for everyone. There is a nice shopping center behind the hotel. Shuttle transportation is provided for $5 a person and can be lined up with a phone call to pick you up from the airport when you arrive and take you back the day you depart - but you can also take the subway from the airport to the hotel. If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel that is clean and comfortable and just a short subway ride to everything this is the place for you. We will see you in April!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the car enjoyed it....”
Reviews.Author: maxclancy72
Reviews.Content: ... but no one else did. We stayed for the night before an early flight out of Logan; the car stayed for a week. The hotel was difficult to find using hotel's online directions; had to call home for some reference. The mystery directions added about 30 minutes of driving late night in fringe areas of South Boston. Not exactly a sterling start to a week vacation. Even when located, the directions brought us to the wrong end of a one way. Check in was quick and easy. Room was 'non-smoking' however was clearly not. Smokey smell was strong enough to keep us awake. 5am transfer to airport was quick and timely. Pick up on return trip was not as efficient. A miscommunication between front desk and driver over which terminal we were waiting at led to a 45 minute wait in a cold rain. Overall nothing catastrophic however it was a rather sour bookend to an otherwise fantastic vacation. There are plenty of other park, stay, & fly options around Logan and we'll be looking elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “so far away from boston”
Reviews.Author: LovesLondon415
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in Boston city center. I learned that the hard way as I left Boston South Station and traveled down the highway to what looked like a highway exit to where my hotel was. In order to take the subway you needed to walk across a bridge to what looked like a rundown neighborhood. I had to cab it. the room was fine. it looked like the hotel was going through major renovations. it was quiet. the free breakfast was fine too. if you need a quick hotel to stay in and don't mind cabbing it into the city then this is fine for the price. but if you have the ability - stay in boston city center as it's a pain.

Reviews.Title: “Hit Or Miss”
Reviews.Author: hotelguest10001
Reviews.Content: i stayed here four times and had good exp.twice and not so good the other two times but will give them another chance and see if its better next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel outside of city center”
Reviews.Author: aikman04
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy to reach from the freeway and has free parking. It is located at about a 5-10 minutes walk from a subway station. From this subway station you can get to locations in the city center in about 10 minutes. There is a free shuttle bus from the hotel to the subway. The room were basic and clean. The breakfast was not good. When we arrived most of it was already gone, even though we arrived half an hour before breakast was closed. But overall this is a decent hotel, nothing fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Love the cinnamon rolls at breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Yung4fr
Reviews.Content: A GF and I (2 females) stayed here for a weekend Boston trip. Good value hotel with great breakfast -- I do like their cinnamon rolls if you did not get that from the title. :-) The hotel is 0.4 miles walk to the nearest metro station; not bad of a walk although a little quiet at night, but we did not feel unsafe. The hotel was undergoing renovations (outside walls) while we were staying and on the Saturday morning of our stay, there were workers outside our window by 7AM. Good thing we were already up and had the blinds drawn, so if the renovation is still on going, ask for a room away from the renovation if you are a late sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Park, Stay and Fly with up to 21 days free parking here - what a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: Stonington-Sue
Reviews.Content: I must admit I was slightly concerned by a few of the earlier reviews I'd read but decided to give this place a try. If you're looking for scenic this isn't the place, however, if you want somewhere clean to lay your head and a good shuttle service to Boston Logan, look no further! We usually stay at the Doubletree near the University which is good for this type of stay too but they don't offer the additional days parking beyond ten or is it fourteen - not sure on that. I have no idea why as they have a huge car park and I don't want to pay $10 a day to leave my car there on the extra days!! (Note to management - OK, so it's in the wrong place!). Definitely follow their recommended exit as your GPS will tell you something different and if you're arriving after dark, it's not that easy to see as it's tucked away, slightly set back from the road. However, I called from nearby and they were easily able to point me in the right direction! The lady at the front desk was very helpful - a resourceful and unflappable type - just the right sort for that job! The room was perfectly adequate, clean and tidy. I wasn't able to stay for the breakfast as I had to head off early but if it's included, why not take advantage if you can?! My car was safe and sound when I got back and the shuttle driver stopped right in front and loaded my bags into the trunk - wonderful! You wait at the Hotel Courtesy Bus stop, right outside - Terminal E, in my case and they were there very promptly. Would I stay here again? Yes, why not? The only thing I didn't enjoy was that the heater is a little loud, but if you consider that white noise, it's helpful! If not, heat the room and then just turn it off when you turn in. It was absolutely fine. On the plus side, it's the most economical place I could find in Boston and does exactly what it says on the tin! Oh! One last thing - if you have a choice, don't park under the trees near the fence as the birds will be busy while you're away!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: valui
Reviews.Content: What can you say .We enjoyed our stay, the staff very accomodating and helpful, the beds comfortable and clean , internet available in lobby and a good breakfast. There was a guest laundry which was very useful and a gym which never seemed to be in use. The shuttle bus was handy to take you to the station altougfh we walked a few times as it was good exercise and not very far. We also had dinner at Applebees which was excellent and had huge servings., and did shopping in the mall next door. The only bad thing was we got a taxi from the airport instead of the shuttle and wasted a few dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: Curlywurly3669
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the lovely smiles of the Girls on Reception to the Shuttle Bus Driver dropping us off at the Cruise Port, we had a great time. Our room was lovely and clean with a great comfortable bed. Didnt have much of a view but that didnt matter as we only stayed one night. The Breakfast buffet was great and the Staff were very polite and friendly. Just a few minutes walk away was a retail park with a Target store on it which was great for buying all your forgotten toiletries and stuff. Have already earmarked a return visit to Boston next year and hope I`ll be able to use this Hotel again. The Hotel had an External (I think) refurbishment going on when we arrived but that should be over soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, first quality staff”
Reviews.Author: raya06
Reviews.Content: This is my first review online, but the service I received at the Holiday Inn Express was so outstanding I feel compelled to thank the great staff. First, Gina and her beautiful smile who was an outstanding hostess. Miguel the bus driver who was wonderful. Everyone from the desk clerks to the cleaning staff maintained a professional attitude with a wonderful smile. They have shuttle to the airport as well as the convention center which was so convenient. The free breakfast was excellent, clean and delicious. Guests are treated like royalty. The location is excellent next to a great shopping center with restaurants and a Target. I highly recommend. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A very economical place to stay for Boston”
Reviews.Author: paiawahine
Reviews.Content: We were at this HI Express 2 years ago and so this year we returned because of the wonderful service and price. Two years ago the shuttles were free but this year it was $5 per person from the airport to the hotel and also $5 to Black Falcon, which was fine with us. There are 2 computers in the lobby for the guests to use free of charge. Also breakfast is included which is extensive such as eggs, sausage, cereal, juices, fresh fruits etc. which filled us up. Upon arrival, we met a couple that I knew from a previous cruise and we walked over to the restaurants, which is quite close to the hotel. We were going to eat at the Olive Garden but the wait was 45 min. and no wait at Applebees. The next time we stay at the HI Express, I'd like to order from Alfredo's and have them deliver and eat it at the breakfast room. Target is in the same shopping area which is convenient if one needs things that were forgotten or couldn't take into the plane as carry-on before going to Black Falcon cruise terminal. The bathroom had the usual, bath soap bars, lotion and shampoo/conditioner and nice thick towels. Someday, we'd like to stay a little longer and explore Boston more.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Boston & Logan Airport - hard to find”
Reviews.Author: DSandJB
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night before getting a flight home, but the service at check in was good - although they had us booked in rooms on different floors they changed this without being asked. As previous reviewers have said there is a good breakfast area which seemed full of people at all hours of the day and night, and the refurbishment work on the outside of the hotel doesn't affect the inside or alter the comfort of the rooms. Our biggest problem with the Holiday Inn was finding the way in - if you come from the north on I93 (Route 1) then it's easy, but coming from the south and turning into Boston Street you can't get to it easily. Directions from the south - exit I93 at exit 16 for Southampton Street. Go left on Southampton Street over I93 and then turn back to re-join I93 going south, but instead of joining I93 keep right to enter the hotel car park.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stopover”
Reviews.Author: EllieK016
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before flying home to Scotland. The hotel was in an excellent location, only 5 minutes by taxi to Quincy Market. The rooms were clean and spacious, the beds extremely comfortable and best of al the hotel runs a shuttle to and from the airport for only $5 per person each way (use the phone in the arrivals hall to arrange your pick up). Excellent complementary hot breakfast and free coffee 24/7. Although the hotel is undergoing remodelling, this had no impact on our Saturday night stay. The staff were extremely efficient and friendly and I would have no hesitation in booking this hotel for a longer stay

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Sturmey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 nights and found the overall service very good and the staff particularly helpful. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. The breakfast choice was brilliant and the only critisism would be an occasional queue for the (one) toaster. The shuttle bus collected us from the airport which made life easy. The local metro station is no more than a 10 minute walk away although we did make use of the free shuttle service to the sation on a couple of occasions. I think that a good indication of the overall experience would be the fact that we would unquestionably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Flyoctober
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at the hotel. It was very convenient to the "T'. A very quick walk was ideal with young children. The hotel was clean, the staff were polite and friendly and very helpful. I enjoyed using the treadmill in the exercise room. The breakfast was perfect for us and very tasty and suited all our needs (including our sometimes fussy children). The walk to the 'South bay' shopping centre was great - we enjoyed shopping in Target, especially - such good prices! Thanks for a great stay - would highly recommend the hotel, well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: SunnyCalGirl4ever
Reviews.Content: Perfect location...just a few miles from downtown Boston, and just a 5 minute walk to the "T" (subway) station. The employees went out of their way to help us in every way they possibly could. The hotel was very quiet and clean and served a hot breakfast to get us going every day. It was a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good except for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RobRobJenJen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in August 2010, Â£100/night booked 8 weeks in advance. There was a 10 mins walk to subway (if directed correctly!) or you can get a courtesy lift there at set times. It's about 10-15 mins to/from downtown on the subway. The room was huge. (See photo for view from it) Coffee was always available in the lounge. Breakfast was basic with some hot food. As with the other Holiday Inn Express that we used on this holiday (N Conway NH) there was no free space on either day to sit to eat it. (We came back later to the remnants on the first day and on the second day we took the food to our room!) (One of 8 accommodations reviewed this holiday)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Boston”
Reviews.Author: PollyannaDreamgirl
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a 2-day pre-cruise based on price and location. It was half the price of in-town hotels, and close to the public transportation (subway lines). There were several restaurants within walking distance (Applebee's and Olive Garden), as well as a grocery store and office supply store. The hotel had a shuttle for $5 a person that picked up or delivered to the airport, PLUS picked up or delivered to Black Falcon Wharf (the cruise terminal). They also told us that when we returned from our cruise, we could call for the shuttle (for $5), store our luggage with them (even though we weren't going to be staying the night), and use their shuttle to return to the airport. It was a nice, clean, space. The beds were very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was the normal continental-style hotel breakfast and tasteful, however they could have used more tables for seating. We had an issue when leaving for the wharf the morning of our cruise. We (4 of us) had booked the shuttle for an 11:30am departure, when an over-zealous tour director demanded they take her whole group on that paticular shuttle. The hotel manager actually loaded up our luggage, and personally drove the 4 of us to our cruise ship. Great customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Tamwam
Reviews.Content: Was a little worried about choosing this place because of reviews but was pleasantly surprised. I did not feel unsafe at anytime even walking to and from the subway. If you are a typical suburbia american you might feel a little out of your element but get over it. It is a big city after all, I did see a little graffiti. I have an 11 and 13 year old girl and we were fine walking around the area. The accomodations were fine and the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “This was deifinitely not up to the quality of other Holiday Inn Expresses.”
Reviews.Author: BobMRoch
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn Express fell far short of the standards set by other H.I.E.s. The breakfast buffet was not well attended, nor did it have the variety of other H.I.E.s. For two days their signature cinnamon rolls were not even available. During our entire stay the printer attached to the public PC in the lobby was low on toner and printed half the page very, very faintly and the staff seemed uninterested in doing anything about it. The overall condition of the place was getting "tired" and badly needed renovation. Additionally, many amenities and creature comforts seemed to be missing. In general, there were many relatively minor errors, but when added all together made for a stay that was less than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great park sleep and fly hotel”
Reviews.Author: kidfamilytravels
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a great experience at this hotel. We stayed there the night before flying out of Logan. The staff there was very helpful. The rooms were nice. The exercise room was open early and late morning hours (which is when I tend to work out), and this was super-convenient. The shuttle to the airport came promptly at both ends of our trip. The park sleep and fly package is a great value and we would definitely be interested in staying at the hotel again before a future flight, and maybe on other trips to Boston as well.

Reviews.Title: “On the ball”
Reviews.Author: carolinaboss
Reviews.Content: My companies have used several Boston hotels for business over the past year and have finally found a home. Convenient-with great value-they are very good to us-like a home away from home-feel confident in sending both employees and clients there-great job,personal service,good for my business.Keep up the great work!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place”
Reviews.Author: drhemlockccw
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston/Cape Cod just to see the sights. Stay here for 4 nights and were very pleased. 10 minute walk to the "T", three restaurants/delis close by, shuttle to and from airport and free good breakfasts. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Prices were descent, for Boston. The rooms were clean and well maintained. I'd stay here again if we ever visit Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the money”
Reviews.Author: SCHu89
Reviews.Content: Hotel a little tired and rough around the edges. However if you need budget hotel accommodation in Boston it's not a bad choice, about a 5-7 minute walk to the subway which was OK in the day, we didn't fancy the walk at night which meant taxis were required to get back to the hotel (between $10 to $17 from city centre). Close to a busy Interstate, but the constant noise from the traffic could not be heard in our room. Staff very friendly, couldn't do enough to provide information, and shuttle bus to the airport at $5 each way per person was excellent value. The complimentary breakfast is basic and no-frills but the coffee was OK and available throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for visiting Boston”
Reviews.Author: CrowNSW
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel mainly because of cost. Very wary with so many mixed reviews, however we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel was very clean, the staff most helpful and the breakfast, whilst basic,was more than adequate. We booked Beantown trolley tickets from the hotel so we were picked up at 8:30am by trolley shuttle and returned from the city by 5:30pm for the 2 days, so didn't need to use Andrew T station. Contrary to some reviewers comments, there are several nearby options for evening meals ranging from the Olive Garden Italian (always very busy) and Applebees (great steak and cod) in the adjacent shopping centre to a more upmarket Italian called 224 at, obviously, 224 Boston Rd, just a short walk away. In our opinion, a great budget location.

Reviews.Title: “it's better searching for other hotel”
Reviews.Author: lore77italy
Reviews.Content: We stayed fo one night; it rained from the wall all the night and the hotel answer was "extra towel"!!!! wonderful breakfast from 6 a.m.; not far from the subway, but in an ugly area of the city.

Reviews.Title: “DONT DO IT”
Reviews.Author: reeds
Reviews.Content: spent two nights at this hotel in July. I chose it because the cost was substantially cheaper than hotels near the boston attractions. I also did some research and found out the hotel was near the subway. In fact, the subway is only a few blocks away- not a bad spot, actually. The room itself was very disappointing. The hotel just seemed to be a bit dated, could use a freshen up..I can even live with that, im not the most picky guy..but what I have to say next is TRUE, and I seriously cannot believe it happened. The first night, just getting ready for bed, and I dropped something near the bed. I bend over to pick it up, and I see what looks like a mouse trap. Closer look- yep, a mouse trap. The trap was between the wall and the bed, and the trap was set. NO mouse was in the trap, but I seriously could not believe what I saw. My thoughts were this: Did this hotel have mice? If so, would you really attempt to kill them while paying customers slept in the hotel? What if they caught the mouse, would they risk the chance of a dead mouse be in the trap while customers stayed there? I even thought, maybe it was a prank from the last guests..Probably with that theory is, if it were a prank, certainly the maids would have seen the trap, and taken it away! Of course they would, UNLESS they cleaned the room so POORLY, they didn't even look near the headboard and didnt even vacuum the room! Either way its a LOSE LOSE for this property.. I even sent management an email, explaining the situation..Not even an offer to make it right!? IF this is how the hotel takes care of its customers, well, you can decide. I will NEVER honor another Holiday inn EVER.

Reviews.Title: “reasonably priced, convenient, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: cathb2910
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights. Free coffee throughout the day, plus cookies at 6pm!, free computers in hotel lobby, free parking, breakfast included and the staff were very friendly and helpful with every query. Subway was only 5 minutes walk away - not sure I'd want to walk back very late at night, but we found it was fine at about 9.30pm. Would have liked more choice of places to eat near the hotel - we ate at The Olive Garden (good) and Applebees (not so good) in the shopping centre. Beware - although the address is Boston Street, you can't actually drive into the hotel from Boston Street, much to the annoyance of our sat-nav!! You have to go in through the South Bay shopping centre. Would definitely recommend this as a cheap but adequate hotel to stay - free parking was a real bonus, and it's only 15 mins from Logan airport. Although right next to the freeway, we weren't disturbed by any traffic noise (and our room was about as close as you could get to the road.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: okfergy2
Reviews.Content: We parked our car and took the trains into Boston. The station was within walking distance of the motel. They serve a large breakfast buffet. Parking is free. It is a short drive to the airport. Unless you have to be down in the heart of the city, this is a great place to stay with decent rates for the area. (I made an advance purchase and saved quite a bit of money.)

Reviews.Title: “Close to the T, clean rooms and free parking”
Reviews.Author: Emilie80
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn on Boston Street is one of the very few downtown hotels that offers free parking. The Hotel is very close to the Andrew T stop on the red line, walking to the station takes approx. 8 minutes. Breakfast and Wi-fi are complementary as well and the rooms are clean. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for price & close to subway and bus station”
Reviews.Author: Lizzyla74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights here with our five month old. We found the staff to be helpful and friendly. The room was fairly "no frills" but clean and comfortable, plus a baby crib was provided at no extra cost. There is a buffet breakfast included, with a simple but varied selection of foods. Coffee is available downstairs throughout the day and also coffee makers in the bedrooms. Although dinner is not available there are several companies that deliver takeaways to the room (pizza from Alfredo's was particularly good). This area of Boston is fairly down market but is close to the airport and just a few subway stops from the city centre (Andrew station on the red line). There's a large general store (Target) nearby plus a supermarket a short walk away. Although it's situated next to the freeway we were not aware of excess traffic noise. We would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the most modern hotel, but close to train station”
Reviews.Author: CaziMontreal
Reviews.Content: Average hotel, but offers breakfast and is close to train station - app. 15 minutes from Boston Downtown

Reviews.Title: “Average but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Smallwood4
Reviews.Content: This is your average Holiday Inn but the staff was exceptional. Only draw back was the location - it's not close to anything except the shopping center next door. It is definately NOT within walking distance to the subway station, especially during bad weather or at night. We ended up catching a cab to get back to the hotel late one night & even then I was scared in that neighborhood at night (hanging out at the Dunkin Donuts until the cab arrived). Next time, I'll spend a little more $ and get closer to city.

Reviews.Title: “great staff and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: soft8800
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff of Carol Gutierrez, Sarahi Ayala and Gwen Kimble were very accomadating and helpful. They had happy personalities and were eager to help and assist. The subway is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: yumas_nl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in June. This place offers good value for money; clean rooms, friendly staff and a 5 minute walk to the T's red line, which takes you downtown in only 10 to 15 minutes (about 3 stops).

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Member From Shellharbour Australia
Reviews.Content: Much nicer than expected. Pleasant helpful staff, nice room and very good value for money overall. Reasonable breakfast. Short 5 min walk to shopping and Applebees, and about 10 minute easy walk to Andrew T Station. The area is not overly fancy and while walking is fine during the day, there are not a lot of people around after hours. If you have any concerns, a cab ride at time of writing was $6 from downtown, a small price for peace of mind. They also have a shutte to airport for nominal fare. Overall, excellent value for money and nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheating with the room type”
Reviews.Author: zxcvmnbv
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night there, I booked and paid in advance for 2 rooms with 2 double beds, and requested connecting rooms since we have teenagers, the ladies at the front desk were very nice AT the beginning, she said the connecting rooms are not avaialable, the best they can do is next or across, with queen or 2 doubles. I picked 2 rooms next to each, and thought they are 2 doubles (my mistake), then I realized I misunderstood. So, I went down and ask to change to the room across (politely), which was empty and have 2 doubles. One of the lady said they already told me there is no 2 doubles available, which I'm sure one choice was 1 queen and 2 doubles. Anyway, her face turned mean & sound nasty, and found a room on the other floor, I told her I need them on the same floor and close to each other, she said nothing is available, so I stay with the queen rooms. I mentioned to her, I booked and paid for the rooms with 2 doubles, which costs more than the single queen room, and she said that is no guarantee. I was so disappointed and would like to share this to everyone. This is the wrost Holiday Inn Express I've ever stayed with.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, free internet, central location, friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: DJM2320
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old son and I stayed 4 nights at this hotel during a tour of universities in the Boston area. The staff was very helpful and friendly, parking was free, internet was free, breakfast included. We were on a two week tour of East Coast Colleges and this was by far the best value hotel we stayed in and the accommodations were as good as some places we stayed that charged twice as much. Convenience to the Andrew 'T' Station made it easy to get around Boston without using a car (though we had one for the rest of our tour outside Boston). I have an 18 year starting at Berklee this fall and will consider staying here again during his move-in weekend/orientation. I've looked for hotels closer to Berklee but all are twice the cost without the frills of free breakfast, free internet and free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price but some disappointments”
Reviews.Author: cbhickey2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four night while our family vacationed in Boston/Cape Cod. Selected this hotel due to its price, breakfast, ratings, and proximity to the subway station (Andrews - Red Line). Hotel prices (and parking) are very high downtown and this was the closest, reasonably priced ($150) hotel I could find. It was faily easy to get to and parking was free and secure but limited. The parking lot was shared with an adjacent hotel so I guess we could've parked over there if needed. The attached restaurant is currently closed but their is a shopping plaza directly behind the hotel that has an Applebees and Olive Garden. The plaza also has all the big boxes such as Target, Best Buy, etc. I takes about ten minutes to walk to the stores. The subway is near but a little longer than the 5 minute walk they claim. Closer to 10 minutes and the area you walk through is one I wouldn't be in after dark. During the day I felt very safe though. Very easy to learn the subway system and you can get all your passes right at Andrews Station. No problems at all with the entire subway system in Boston. Expected to see many buses too like Chicago and D.C. but they didn't exist at least downtown. The hotel was a little disappinting. The breakfast was very good with a lot of variety but the eating area is small and most days we had difficulty getting a table. They have coffee available all day and night and serve chocolate chip cookies at 6 PM nightly. The staff was very friendly and helpful with suggestions. Housekeeping was also responsive to any request we made. The room itself was not the greatest. It did have a fridge which was nice and the beds were large for doubles, almost queen size and very comfortable. The two problems I had was even though we had four people in the room they were very stingy with the bathroom towels and nightly we had to call housekeeping for more. One day they left a single wash cloth for four people to use! The main problem I had with the room was a mouse evidently was staying with us too as one night it got into our snack bag and had a field day. I informed housekeeping of this and they said they'd tell the front desk about it but nothing ever became of it. We secured everything from then on inside a lock suitcase. The bathroom was a little rundown and even had a hole in the baseboard where I presume the mouse family was staying. Maybe they were taking our towels?? But overall I'd recommend this hotel due to its price and location but would suggest you look around a little more. The hotel adjacent to this one look better and I think it was only $10-20 more per night. I'd probably stay there next time in town. Being near a subway stop is very important though as driving and parking in Boston is impossble. Boston and Cape Cod are great places to visit and we had a good time. Four days is plenty to see everything. The Freedom Trail in Boston is good but be aware most buildings along the way require a separate admission. Fenway Park was very good and be sure to spend time at the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, convenient choice”
Reviews.Author: NewportJC
Reviews.Content: No complaints. The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is right off the highway and has plenty of free parking. There's a "T" station a 10-minute walk away to get to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel to attend conferences & exhibitions at Convention center Boston”
Reviews.Author: PRATHAPA
Reviews.Content: Clean , value for money and convenient hotel, to attend conferences and exhibitions in Boston Convention Center. Hotel has shuttle to airport and convention center makes it very convenient for traveller attending. I stayed all the thrre times I visited BOSTON SEAFOOD SHOW

Reviews.Title: “Now this is a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: DCAlexander
Reviews.Content: I looked at alot of hotels in Boston and went out on a limb on this one, but it paid off. The price was amazing ($112), the location perfect, and free parking and breakfast to boot. We had no complaints at all. Sure the furniture was a bit forlorn and ragged, but who cares? It was clean, quiet, friendly, and close to downtown. The only downside was that it was hard to get to, but after the first time that's not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “I was very impressed with the quality and friendliness of the service.”
Reviews.Author: bdonick
Reviews.Content: Everyone we met at the hotel was very pleasant and helpful, but we were extremely impressed by Carol Gutierrez who managed the front desk. She was very busy but made everyone feel that she was doing her best to insure that they would be well taken care of.. When we had a problem with our room, she quickly resolved it and was also helpful with information about traveling in the area.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERIOR SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: dianedee23
Reviews.Content: Checkin was prompt and hassle free! Needed 2 double beds, but hotel was booked and instead of giving me a hard time, GINA COLON, at front desk went out of her way to accommodate me. She was fantastic! Again, asked the front desk for a good seafood restaurant and SARAHI AYALE, went the extra mile and called the UNION OYSTER HOUSE (BEST SEAFOOD EVER) to get directions and parking and printed me a copy of the driving directions. The room was clean, comfortable beds and FABULOUS BREAKFAST. A MUST STAY IF IN BOSTON!!! THANKS AGAIN TO GINA AND SARAHI at front desk for all their help. You made my Boston trip memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room but no frills”
Reviews.Author: ModerationForMe
Reviews.Content: A colleague of mine picked this hotel. We were meeting in town, so we had to commute via two trains. The commute wasn't too bad, and the walk to/from Andrew Station seemed quite safe, even at night. I took the hotel shuttle from the airport which was also convenient and a good bargin at $5. My main complaint would the exercise room. It had the basics, but one treadmill did not work, and only a short person would be able to use the stair master without his/her head hitting the ceiling. There was a water boil order while I was there (this was not the hotels fault -- the entire city of Boston and neighboring communities was without safe water). They did have a sign mentioning it, but no notice in the room, and no bottled water was offered.

Reviews.Title: “Saved me a bundle”
Reviews.Author: kenpoguy
Reviews.Content: I used to stay in other 3 star or 4 star hotels in the past, mostly reserved from Hotwire. The problem with that is you never know the location or name of the hotel until its too late. This time I booked it through Priceline and I knew ahead of time which hotel I would be staying at and was also able to find out its amenities before booking my room. And I must say, I have not been disappointed at all. The service was great and prompt. We were upgraded to a bigger room at no cost. The condition and cleanliness of the room was no better or worse than the other hotels I've stayed in the past (Double Tree, Crown Plaza, Radisson etc). The lobby and the reception area are very modest. They did have free Internet services from the lobby, which was great for the kids when they'd get bored while waiting for us in the lobby. The location of this hotel was another reason we decided to stay there. It was 5 minutes walking distance from the Red line (Andrew subway station). I do not like to drive in unfamiliar cities, especially when I have to visit several locations and places. The unfamiliar traffic patterns and parking are too much of a hassle. Granted that there are other hotels also with this convenience, but they mostly located in the downtown areas where the rates would be double or triple what I paid here. The best thing about this hotel was the free parking and free breakfast, neither of which I had experienced before. With two growing kids and 2 adults, these amenities save me about $80 a day. (Most hotels charge about $25 to park the car a day). There was free wireless Internet throughout the hotel. This was not as fast as we are accustomed to. The Internet speed was about 1 Mbps. But it became better later at nights (when there was less network traffic). What this hotel lacked was a gym, a swimming pool and a restaurant. But we did not miss any of these, as we never used any of these amenities in other hotels we stayed at anyway. All in all, I definitely recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here if I revisit Boston in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: AntsInMyPantsDE
Reviews.Content: I was really disappointed by this Holiday Inn Express. I'm usually really happy with the chain, but found this Boston location to be drab and with a mix of good a bad service. The Marriott next door was actually a little cheaper and all around nicer. From when we checked in, we found the attendant to be unhelpful, unfriendly and even stubborn. When we got to our room, we saw how rundown the place was. The doors and furniture were chipped, dirty, sticky and there was a bad odor that was mixed with a cleaning product smell. Breakfast staff was also mopey. We were told about a 'complimentary' shuttle and when we went to use it, found out our room would be charged. That all being said, we did find our other staff encounters to be pleasant and helpful during the remainder of our stay. The walk to the subway is very short, and the hotel is right off of the highway, which makes it rather convenient. The neighborhood setting is nothing too nice, I'm not sure I would be comfortable walking to the subway stop alone as a young woman dressed in business attire.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: alocin42
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed for three (very wet!) nights in March and given the washout the hotel was the best part of the trip. Until recently we would have stayed in hostels or cheap B&Bs as students but now we're both working we can afford to splash out a little more, and you can definitely notice the difference! The hotel is located 10 mins walk from Arthur Metro station on the red line which is only a few stops down from South Station and the centre of Boston. It's close to an expressway but we didn't find noise a problem. The rooms were large and clean, the beds comfortable, the complimentary breakfast was very good including a range such as cereal, toast, eggs, bacon, muffins, very yummy cinnamon rolls. There was always coffee available in the lobby as well as to make in your room and at 6pm each night they produced freshly baked cookies! There was a washer and dryer in the basement with free washing powder which was very handy when all our clean clothes got drenched and staff were happy to help change our money into quarters. We had a very pleasant stay despite the weather and I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “GReat park, sleep, fly deal”
Reviews.Author: Hoot06
Reviews.Content: just bring ear plugs if you need quiet to sleep as the walls are pretty thin. Other than that this was a great experience. Shuttle was quick, car was fine, hotel was clean, it's very close to Logan, and the staff was very helpful and efficient. Easy to get to - right off the highway.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: libboy
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Boston Convention and Exhibition Center and took the subway every day. The Andrew stop on the Red Line is only a short walk away. Be sure to purchase a "Charlie Card" to save on transportation costs. Even though I was there for only four days I saved several dollars using that "Charlie Card". When you get off the subway and approach the hotel you may wonder if the neighborhood is safe. That feeling soon went away for me as I had no worries for my safety. The hotel overlooks South Bay mall which has just about every suburban big box store you need -- Target, Best Buy, Marshalls, and others. The hotel is clean and staff friendly. Breakfast wasn't real healthy but tasty and free. Internet access was also free in the lobby and in the rooms. I would return in a heart beat especially after having saved a ton of money at this hotel compared to the downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abhishekca1
Reviews.Content: It is a very good hotel near the metro station. They also provide a pick & drop facility to the city centre & down town.

Reviews.Title: “Save a bucket by staying at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: letyoursoulglo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights after reading Tripadvisor and noticing that it is a short walk to the train. We are very glad we did. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly, especially when the room they initially put us in stank of cigarette smoke and I requested a new room - they obliged immediately. Free wi-fi here and free cookies - nice touch. Internet terminals were a little slow, but big deal. The breakfast was fine with different options daily and the subway station was only a few stops from the centre of town. Our room was fine, no issues there. There is also an enormous outdoor mall next door with eating options and shopping so you don't want for anything (no restaurant on site). Stay at this nice HI Express and save downtown prices - you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Already looking forward to the next stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jadiejen
Reviews.Content: Although our stay was only one night and we spent very little time in the room other than sleeping, I feel the need to review this great hotel! The staff was friendly, the hotel was clean and well decorated and our room was gorgeous! My husband and I were both pleasantly surprised by the high quality comforter and pillows on the bed. I hate the ususal cheap wool blankets that most lower priced hotels/motels use. The bed was comfortable and I slept great. I didn't even have to use my own pillows that I ALWAYS travel with. The continental breakfast was delicous and well stocked (even though we came out less than an hour before breakfast hours ended). The cinnamon buns were even better than described in other reviews. I even took one for the road. I am very much looking forward to staying here again in the future for a longer stay!!! We also enjoyed the free parking and high speed internet. The only things I can criticize are the lack of swimming pool and the peeling ceilling in the corner of our room. However, nothing to keep me from coming back time and time again. Great job Holiday Inn Express Boston!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Take a subway ride away from the expensive city centre hotels and be surprised.”
Reviews.Author: MissyMac78
Reviews.Content: Just a 3 station stop from Boston city centre on the underground and a 6 mins walk (timed) and you will find this smashing hotel. From the outside it looks rather dated and the surrounding area is a mixed bag. But don't be judgemental, inside the reception area is roomy, bright and well laid out. Staff are polite and very helpful. Reasonably priced ($5) minibus service to Airports etc. Free parking is a bonus so near the city. Leave your car and travel by an easily understood underground system. Remember to buy a Charlie ticket ~ great value! Breakfast is adequate with a wide variety offered ~ cheap orange juice was off putting though. Rooms are clean with comfy beds and fairly roomy. The bathroom is poorly laid out especially around the sink area which is a nuisance. However, it is the price and convenience and the good atmosphere which makes this hotel to seriously consider when visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, close enough to city center for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Frunobulax
