Reviews.Content: Although a little shabby from the outside and located between a highway and a shopping mall, the hotel turned out to be a good choice to stay close to the city center (10 minute walk to the subway which takes you to the center in 5 more minutes) for a reasonable price. However, the hotel is located a few miles south of the city center so it is not near to any of the nightlife districts. The room was clean, not too small and quiet (even though the highway was pretty close you couldn't hear it), the hotel has a huge parking lot with free parking for guests, there are two restaurants (Olive Garden and Applebees) in the mall nearby and the breakfast was OK (a typical american breakfast). The staff was always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value”
Reviews.Author: DavidPooleDorset
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed overnight. Staff efficient , courteous and friendly, particularly Gina on front desk on morning of our departure. Facilities good including 24 hr coffee, tea etc. The room was clean with coffee making facilities, fridge, TV, microwave, hairdryer, iron and ironing board. Beds comfortable! The price included breakfast - more than adequate and parking (so often extras in Boston) The hotel was within 10 minutes walk from the train station making it easy to get into the City centre. Only criticism is that hotel cannot be accessed by car from Boston street so sat nav not usable and finding access a bit tricky. Would certainly use hotel again

Reviews.Title: “great service at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Jr61_ca
Reviews.Content: We were 3 couples that stayed at this Hotel on september 10, 2009. Service at the front desk was excellent. (Special thanks to Carol G.) In fact all the staff were great. As others had mentioned, the outside could use a coat of paint. But the inside was very clean, The breakfast area was very convienient. We took the train(subway) which was about a 15 minute walk. We were downtown in no time. That evening we walked down Boston street to an Italian restaurant (recommended by front desk) It was great and at no time did we feel like we were in any danger. We will stay at this hotel on our next visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Money - Excellent Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: dferguson
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights recently. Approx 3 miles from downtown which is easily accessed by underground train from nearby station. Rooms a good size and very clean. Service very good and the breakfast excellent. Coffee and tea available 24 hours a day. Staff very pleasant and helpful at reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: SamuelAdamsMaine
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice this year; each time, the experience was great. Sure, it's great that it is located two blocks from the T station and yes, it is rather convenient that there are stores and restaurants within walking distance. But the biggest perk to staying at this hotel is the people who work there. They are the friendliest and the most professional. They take pride in what they do and they are there to make your vacation enjoyable. Each morning, the Continental breakfast area was always well supplied and kept VERY clean. I am being serious when I say that the employees here take pride in what they do. The front desk people were charming, conversational and helpful. They answered any and all questions I had and they were a joy to work with. I will continue to book all of my stays here at the Holiday Inn Express when I travel to Boston. Mind you, I am not the type of guy who writes reviews; in this case, I feel the need to because everyone there deserves praise for a job well done.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: HolidayJunky007
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised on arrival, the room was large and kept clean. It was sufficiently far enough away from the main road not to cause a nuisance at night and the staff were very helpful. Breakfast was buffet style so busy periods were hectic essentially if a coach party was in at the same time. It is located some way out of town so the Andrew Subway station across the bridge came in very handy, it was relatively cheap for a weeks ticket. I would recommend this hotel to the budget traveller and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Not_a_happy_traveler
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough - this is the second time I've stayed there and had the most wonderful experience!! The staff is incredibly polite, helpful, efficient and friendly; it's located two blocks from a T station, a short hop to Downtown Boston, there are three great restaurant's nearby (Appleby's, Olive Garden and Bickfords) all reasonably priced, a shopping mall a block away with everything you could want, they serve a Continental Breakfast with everything you could want, they're wifi enabled... There was a microwave and fridge in the room and we definitely made use of that!! I'll certainly be happy to stay there again and know I'll be just as happily satisfied!!

Reviews.Title: “Too far away”
Reviews.Author: Sharpay10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night in July. Rooms are small and run down. This hotel is located outside downtown Boston and is priced accordingly. It is located next to a bunch of stores and a couple restaurants (Applebees and Olive Garden) as well as a Target and Old Navy and other stores which are all in walking distance. We traveled from the South Station to hotel and back by taxi. It was too far removed to visit the downtown attractions in the time we had. Next time we will pay the extra $ to be closer to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not memorable, and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: chappers29
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights while in Boston for the marathon in April 2009. THis is a peak time for hotels in Boston, so perhaps prices go up. But still, I think we paid $170 per night which for a hotel of this standard was very poor value. The hotel is right next to a busy highway and unfortunately our room was the closest possible to the road. This meant a lot of noise, and interrupted sleep.`Not great preparation for the marathon. The nicest thing about the hotel was the other guests, particularly those staying for the marathon. Nice camaraderie. Breakfast was poor, but it often is in the USA. I love travelling to the States but hotel breakfasts are usually so mean and functional. Location was poor too. It was about a 10 minute walk to the local subway. There is a local shopping/retail park with a supermarket, a couple of restaurants and some electronic goods shops. It's generally a rather run-down area. In retrospect we should have paid a bit more and got somewhere nicer in the city centre. That said, during marathon week these hotels go for $250-$300 a night. A good alternative would have been to go for a hotel at one of the extremes of the subway system i.e. gone right out of town. Probably a lot cheaper and more pleasant than this. I wouldn't say don't stay at the HIE, but I would say don't stay for 6 nights! I reckon 2 is a good maximum.

Reviews.Title: “Another Overnight while at BCEC”
Reviews.Author: oldfashionedvalues
Reviews.Content: Convenient to BCEC via access road, avoiding South Boston Mess. Shuttle charge instituted after reservation made, no exception made for fee, boss was pissed. This was the original deal maker on pricing versus others with BCEC parking costs. Hotel next to shopping center and two chain restaurants ,so no journeys into unfamiliar territory needed to eat or buy last minute supplies. Free HIE breakfast good, enough protein for low carb dieters, decent cup of coffee too, 24 hrs. Boss liked free cookies at night. Internet service dependable, cell phones (Verizon & AT&T) worked well there. Parking at a premium.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: funnurse
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Boston last week and stayed at the Holiday Inn Express with hubby and our 3 kids. It was great! Price was right, rooms clean, staff wonderful and the complimentary breakfast is wonderful. They serve the usual toasts, bagels, cereal, coffee, juice, milk but also some hot foods, selection varies from day to day. We had bacon, cheese omelets, biscuit sausage gravy. There were also bananas, yogourt,english muffins, etc. A real nice place to go. Don't worry about the outside peeling paint, it doesn't reflect the inside. Also, this hotel is right next to shopping (same parking almost) there's a target, old navy and other stores right next to it as well as Applebee's and Olive Garden. Just wish there was a pool and it would be perfect but we'll be back notheless!

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle service big advantage”
Reviews.Author: Ariii
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel. I travelled with my husband and 2 adult childrenv (19 and 22) We flew into Logan to start our trip to US - The shuttle service to and from the airport is an excellent service, - door to door service $5 very handy. This hotel is very reasonable. The staff were really helpful and very pleasant. Alot of choice for breakfast. My son and daughter were very impressed with the free internet access. Andrew Station is only a short few minutes walk, just 2 or 3 stops into Boston.A member of staff recommended the "224 Restaurant" for an evening meal. This restaurant is only a few minutes from the hotel and we were made very welcome by the staff and enjoyed a beautiful meal. No problem storing suitcases free of charge the day we were checking out. Only negative commnet - we arrived on Fri evening for 3 nights - told breakfast was from 8 -11 but failed to tell us that on mon it is 7 -10 so we missed out on breakfast on the final morning. Reception didn't have any influence so couldn't organise a breakfast for us at ten past ten. Although when all is said and done I would still recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service, easy access to the T, economical, friendly”
Reviews.Author: armymomME
Reviews.Content: Our 1 night stay to send our daughter off to Basic training was made so easy with the friendly customer service, helping w/directions and suggestions for walking. The room was clean, breakfast sufficient, and other guests were friendly and sharing of the lobby computers. Access to the T was an easy walk and our early morning 2 mile walk to the Federal building on Summer St was done without trepidation. It was also an easy access from I-93 S. We will stay here again to visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “a great average hotel in bostopn johnb.”
Reviews.Author: swedenman
Reviews.Content: hi i stayed at the holiday inn south boston for one night june29 i had a a stop over in logan airpp. to and i booked on logan airport via courtesy phonecalls . great the hotel is a bit far and the location is not so great besides the big highway . but anyway its a great average holiday inn hotel the staff was helpful and they were nice its kind of worn and little bit run down but anyway ok . ok for a night stay even a great hotel. from . fr johnnyb.

Reviews.Title: “Definate Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-traveler-04
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and found it to be the best motel of our month in the US. It is not the newest, but the facilities are great, the rooms big, the motel is quiet, staff friendly, next door to a large shopping centre, 200m to a train station, although we used taxi's as it is a $8-10 fare to most of boston. the cookies they bake at 6pm each night are yummy, there are 3 restuarants right next door. I guess the best thing after a large number of the motels we stayed at had poor service was the staff actually smiled and laughed and appeared to like working there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, too far from city center with children”
Reviews.Author: NathDC
Reviews.Content: First the good news: the hotel was very clean, the breakfast was excellent, especially with the kids! And there was the South Bay Shopping Center right next to the hotel, this was really great because the stores were open late. The staff was OK, but we especially remember one lady who was there every morning at breakfast and who was so nice to our kids (they're only 2 and 4, but they still remember her saying "Yummie in the tummy"). She made our stay there extra special! One thing we didn't like was the fact that this hotel was pretty far from Boston's center, we had to take 3 trains to get there and with 2 strollers and sometimes no elevator (or very dirty and smelly ones) we did sometimes regret not getting more info about the location first... But if you want a good ,clean and not too expensive hotel and you have no children, then why not?

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Latvian83
Reviews.Content: I went to Boston for a one week vacation with my wife and we settled in Holiday Inn Express at 69 Boston street. I chose the bank after reading its many reviews. We like the hotel very very much for the following reasons: - The rooms are really nice, spacious and clean. - The staff are really great and friendly, especially the front desk people and they tell you what you need to know about the hotel and its amenities. - The breakfast is served everyday between 6-10 AM on weekdays and between 7-11 AM on weekends and it's such a nice Continental breakfast although it needs more varieties. - They have a complimentary coffee in thermoses all day long and they serve complimentary cookies at 6 pm everyday. - The rooms are provided with Free Wireless internet. - The hotel provides $5 shuttle service to Boston Logan Airport which leaves at the top of the hour. - The location of the hotel is really convenient. It's only 10-15 minutes, walking distance, away from Andrew station and the red line. - The hotel is situated next to The South Bay Center which has all sorts of shops that you need in your everyday shopping which includes: Target, Home Depot, Old Navy, Stop and Shop, Applebeas, Olive Garden, Best Buy, Bank of America. - The only thing I didn't like about the hotel is they have one washer machine only located in the basement and it costs $2.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, safe choice.”
Reviews.Author: Junebug327
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time reading reviews of other hotels in the Boston area and was almost worried about why this hotel was so inexpensive compared to others. We booked anyway, thinking we would deal with discomforts in order to save a bit of money. There was no need to worry. The staff was cheerful and friendly. The room was very clean and attractive. Within a few minutes walk we were able to choose between an Applebee's and an Olive Garden. The breakfast provided for free the next day was not bad, either! It made a great base for adventure.

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem”
Reviews.Author: wallcova
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before but are really please with this hotel. It is clean and the staff friendly. It is only two stops out from the centre of Boston on the Subway so is easy to get to and a samll prcie to apy for how much cheaper it is than the downtown hotels. The brekafast is also a very welcome one. I cannot than k the staff enough for all the help they gave us while we were there. The only thing I would recommend is a refurbishment of the outside as it is looking a little tired and is not a good reflection of the interior of this express Holiday Inn

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: JanetCWyoming_RI
Reviews.Content: Stayed here May 29&30 for DMB at Fenway. Hotel was a great value for the price. Needs outside paint; however, the interior is fine. A short walk to the Red line which can get you to anywhere you want to go in Boston. The area is a bit run down, but we never once felt unsafe, even when returning to the hotel near mid-night. Having a refrigerator and microwave in the room plus a free breakfast buffet was nice. There is a shopping center a five minute walk with Stop&Shop, Target, Olive Garden and many more. If you make your reservations well in advance of your stay, save the hotel as a favorite, and check pricing often. I made my guaranteed reservation in March for this stay, and I reduced the daily base price from the original $144 per night to $104! The rates change often, so check as often as possible. By the time we stayed here, the prices were up to $156/night, but I had locked in at $104. Basically, we stayed two nights for less than one night closer to Fenway, but were totally satisfied. Also, if you stay here and go to a game at Fenway, return via the Fenway stop on the Red Line; you will most likely get a seat. If you return at the Kenmore stop, you are most likely going be standing in a crowd. Still worth taking the T for the savings!

Reviews.Title: “Goog value hotel”
Reviews.Author: paudbrowne
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for the Boston Marathon in April and really enjoyed our stay. The area the Hotel is in looks quite rough at first but we felt safe there even at night time. The train station is 10 min walk from hotel. From there it is a 10 min train ride to the city centre. The breakfast was very good with a nice selection. The rooms are adaquate size. There is a shuttle bus to the airport at $5 per person which is very handy. Over all a good value hotel with easy access in the main attraction of the city. We all also found a nice restrauntant on Boston St. (actually the hotel receptionist recommended it to us). When you come on to Boston St. from the hotel turn right and it is about 4 block up on the right left side. We also enjoyed a few beers in a pub opposite the train station again it looks a bit rough but we felt comfortable there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, and terrific service in a nice, clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rhodar
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Boston just after 11 am, after driving all night, and, even though check-in time is not until 3 pm, we were allowed to have our room right away. The desk clerk was more than helpful, even suggesting that we help ourselves to something from the breakfast room before they finished putting the breakfast bar items away. The price was very reasonable, the room spotlessly clean and very comforable, and the location was good - just a few minutes walk to Andrews Square subway station. The included breakfast was delicious, with lots to choose from, including hot sausage patties, eggs, and wonderul biscuits. The coffee was excellent, and the dining area was impeccable and well stocked, even with dozens of patrons taking advantage of the breakfast buffet. The attendant was very pleasant, even while she was very busy keeping up with restocking the selection of breakfast items. Checkout was a breeze, and we even got help with mapping out our route. Oh, and free parking in Boston? What a bonus! Great job Holiday Inn Express!

Reviews.Title: “Good option for hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: EasyGoingTraveler77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just 1 night so I could catch an early flight the next morning. Everything was just fine - a basic Holiday Inn. Good value. Note that their shuttle to the airport does fill up at peak hours, so you may not be able to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Maddie_RB
Reviews.Content: It may look a little run down from the outside, but it's very nice and clean inside. The rooms were spacious, has a little fridge and microwave. I don't know when the hotel has gone all non-smoking, the original room we were given smelled heavily like cigarettes, so they changed us, but there were still some subtle smells. It's a 5 minute walk to the Andrew subway station on the Red line, one can get to/from Logan just by using the Red and Silver line (change at South Station). Very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Chia33
Reviews.Content: Let's see... nice room with comfortable beds and a microwave (though the bathroom is a little small). I had made a mistake and double booked but the GM corrected it for me with little hassle. Very good breakfast, with sausage/omelet/bacon and lots of other stuff! The location was fine; we drove and it was very convenient with plenty of parking. Definitely enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: fireball50
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid ($109) in Boston, it was good. I will definitely stay here again. Pros: Free Parking - The best part about this hotel because Boston city parking is horrible. Park the car here and take public transportation. Free breakfast - Menu options were very good (hot and cold choice selections) and plenty of space in the dining area. Free wifi internet - Slow at times but overall great. Excellent service - Front desk was very professional and will answer any questions you have here. Cons: Beds are not the best, not very comfortable but it was clean. Door is a lil flimsy and cannot block all the noises in the hallway. Bathroom is on the cramped side. We requested extra towels and they were quick on getting them for us. The walk to the public transportation is a bit on the "shady" side. Not the best neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MelonPicklesMayo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at many hotels, including 4 and 5 star hotels. I have to say that the Holiday Inn Express Boston (a 2 star) was one of the best, if not the best, hotel we've stayed at. The room was large and came with a microwave and fridge (plus TV). The hotel was clean and quiet, the beds were really comfortable, and the hot breakfast, high speed internet, and parking were free (unheard of in Boston) too! The rate, booked through Priceline, was also incredibly reasonable. STAY HERE IF YOU'RE IN BOSTON!!!

Reviews.Title: “TV's Don't Work?”
Reviews.Author: xdanixo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted to stay the weekend in Boston, so we booked at Holiday Inn Express. Its pretty much down a shitty street, we drove by it 3 times and finally found it. The inside was just renovated and we got a room on the second floor. The tv;s didnt work so they gave us another room with a view of the TD BankNorth Garden. It was a nice hotel, except when the bars let out. It was wayyy to loud outside. I wouldnt recommend that side of the hotel. But they breakfast was nice, and theres a parking garage right across the street. Nice walk to Quincy Market..Not far at all.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: HikermanCT
Reviews.Content: A great deal for a hotel close to Boston. We paid less than $100/night for a very nice, clean, comfortable room; the cost of the room included a great breakfast buffet (eggs, bacon, sausage, French toast, English muffins, fruit, etc). The front desk people were extremely helpful and friendly. The T (subway) station is less than a 10 minute walk and in 3 or 4 stops gets you into the center of the city. The neighborhood for most of the way between the hotel and the T station is quiet and well-kept, but the block right around the station was a bit run down. We walked several times, including a late-night walk back to the hotel and had no problems. We would definitely use this hotel next time we visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: BethanyinDallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights while sightseeing in the Boston area. Great location for the price, close to the metro, free parking, decent breakfast buffet, free internet in the lobby. The front desk personnel were extremely friendly and helpful. I loved the toiletries provided in the room. Nothing luxurious, but that wasn't our expectation when we booked it. It was a pleasant stay. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Tea Party”
Reviews.Author: KatyFearn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the first we stayed in on our trip and we knew at least that it was good, clean and supplied us with a buffet Breakfast to start us on our way. We were recommended this hotel by an ex-collegue of my partner's who had stayed here the previous August. The room provided everything we were looking for and was comfortable- a good nights sleep after a day of sight seeing. The breakfast was a buffet with a good selection of muffins, toast cereals and some hot items like bacon and sausage gravy (a mystery to us scots!). If you have a car when in Boston, this hotel offers a car park and is just of the I-95. The only reason I might not rate this hotel more highly is that if you plan to use the subway, it is 10 minutes away and the surrounding area is not one to hang around in after dark. The subway does attract people to it and they seem to hang there after dark. Would not recommend people walk in the area alone at night. However, another positive, well for all you shoppers (me and not my poor partner) there is a large retail park located directly behind the hotel with a good selection of shops, restaurants and a supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Boston Hotel - With Free Parking!!”
Reviews.Author: SteveHammer
Reviews.Content: If you want a reasonably priced, clean hotel, with free parking and easy access to a subway stop this is it. The hotel is situated about a 5/10 minute walk from Andrew Station. Although you wouldn't class the area as upmarket it certainly seems safe enough. We walked back and to to the station both in daylight and at night and never felt unsafe at all. In fact we hardly encountered anyone.Trains run regularly into Boston from here and we never had to wait more than five minutes for one to turn up. The hotel backs on to a shopping strip with Target, Old Navy, Famous Footwear etc plus an Applebees. All the staff we encountered during our stay were very friendly, cheerful and helpful. Actualy I dont think I've stayed at a hotel where "all " the staff were this nice. Good selection of breakfast items. They could do with a couple of extra toasters though as it did get a bit busy at times. The rooms are your typical Holiday Inn rooms. We were on the fifth floor and had a great view of the Boston skyline. If you're going to Boston and are taking a car this is an excellent choice for the free parking alone, PLUS, It'll only cost you about half the price of a city centre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday inn Express stay”
Reviews.Author: tab00007
Reviews.Content: We needed an affordable place to stay while in Boston on our vacation. This was one of the most inexpensive places near Downtown Boston. The parking was free which is a huge plus in the area. Many hotels were charging a lot of money for parking. It was a short walk to the train station to get to downtown. For the location and price the hotel was great. Many hotels were charging 150 bucks for the same night and just down the street. This was a great deal on the hotels website. In regards to some other comments mentioning the area of the hotel I did not mind the neighborhood having to walk to the train. I guess in the evening it could be a differnt story.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lseamone
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at this hotel. I believe it has gone through some improvements since we were here last. It's a great location to hop the subway to anywhere in Boston. We came by car, and parking is free. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. We checked in fairly early and a room was ready. Front counter staff very friendly and accomodating. The breakfast was very good-hot and cold.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: IvyMom
Reviews.Content: Great value. Enjoyed our stay. Free shuttle to airport was delayed by a parade; hotel arranged for substitute from another hotel to keep us on schedule. Hearty breakfast, patient, informative staff. Safe & clean. Taxi service was not reliable during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place To Stay...”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Bruces
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend trip to Boston. The hotel is close to the subway (red line) which will take you to downtown Boston in minutes. From there, you can walk almost anywhere. This hotel is conveniently close to a mall with a Target, Old Navy, Marshalls, Olive Garden, and an Applebee's. If you are adventurous, you can walk down Boston St. and dine at 224. It was a nice little find for a late night dinner. Very friendly staff and great food. Our room on the third floor was clean and served it's purpose. Somewhere to rest for our next day out and about. The continental breakfast hit the spot for a quick meal before starting our day. We had no complaints about this Holiday Inn Express. The price fit nicely into our budget. We will be coming back to this hotel on our next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “OK. Not great, but OK.”
Reviews.Author: thosetwo
Reviews.Content: We hadn't been to Boston in quite a few years and were astounded at the prices for downtown hotels. The HI Express was by far the best price we found on a decent hotel, and it is decent: clean, friendly staff, free hi-speed internet, reasonable breakfast. The trade-off is the location. Msgr O'Brien Highway is an industrial strip, a bit dingy, ripe for renewal. We never felt unsafe though and spent a good deal of time walking around that part of Cambridge. The Lechmere T stop is within half a mile and that proved very handy. All in all, a good value.

Reviews.Title: “exccellent value”
Reviews.Author: sallybristol001
Reviews.Content: arrived at the hotel by hotel shuttle after leaving drivers licence in a washington hotel so unable to rent a car, friendly staff, complimentary breakfast & tea, coffee & hot chocolate always available during the day. The local Mall was just over the small parking lot with applebees & the Olive Garden restaurants, we used the shuttle to take us to the harbour for a little exploring & the next day bought a 2 day pass to explore Washington on a hop on hop off bus, we were collected in the morning from the hotel & taken to a central point & used the bus to get around the city, there were two stops close to each other (near the start and end of the journey) which would take you back without having to transverse the whole city to get to the final stop, a complimentary harbour cruise was on offer too. We were taken back to our hotel at 5pm, or you can use the subway, a short walk back to the hotel. Free internet access available in the lobby was useful and available for longer than the 10mins stated if there was no queue to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great find for Marathon weekend”
Reviews.Author: farmgrl
Reviews.Content: Our party of 3 stayed for 4 nights during Marathon weekend at the HI Express. The hotel was full with many marathoners from other parts of the world also staying here. The halls were very quiet at night! Just like other reviewers have mentioned - the staff was friendly and helpful, buffet breakfast was all we needed to get going in the morning, access to the T was quick and easy, rooms were clean. The staff also accomodated it's marathon guests by having breakfast at 5:00 a.m. (2 hrs early) on race day. The whole experience was positive except that we had to have a smoking room and the windows don't open. I am still airing out the suitcases! All in all we felt this hotel was a great deal in comparison to other places ( I discussed this with other spectators on race day). I too spent days researching on TA to choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great budget find in Boston”
Reviews.Author: gustavsnarp
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect, the room was fairly spacious and quite clean. The staff was friendly and had no problem with our arrival before check in time. The breakfast wasn't great, but it was free and better than just donuts. The rates are much lower than downtown. Their is absolutely nothing wrong with the neighborhood, it's not rich, but it's perfectly safe and reasonable. The walk to the subway is quick and easy. I cannot imagine staying anywhere else in Boston unless I wanted a luxury hotel or made some amazing find. There is also a little italian deli nearby for cheap eats as well as a shopping center where you can get most anything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: AEO
Reviews.Content: My son and I booked a room at the Holiday Inn Express located at 69 Boston Street in Boston, Massachusettes while doing a college visit. I researched for several days for a reasonably priced hotel in Boston that was close to downtown (not an easy feat!) We were THRILLED with the accomodations! The room was VERY clean, the bed was extremely comfortable, the breakfast was nice and our stay was very pleasant! All at a very reasonable price!!!!! The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Andrew train station which will take you downtown in a matter of minutes! Very convenient and easy to use! (We'd never ridden a subway before and were initially intimidated.) The hotel is also a short block from a large shopping mall with Old Navy, Bed, Bath and Beyond, Target, and much more! The hotel baked fresh chocolate chip cookies every afternoon for the guests to enjoy! The staff was pleasant and helpful! We'd DEFINITELY stay there again! The only negatives I could come up with were that the walls seemed alittle thin and we could hear noise in the hallway at night, but it did not disturb us. The area that the hotel is located in is also not an area one would walk around to sight see. However, if you're looking for a reasonably priced, clean and conveniently located hotel near downtown...book a room here!

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel near T for tourists”
Reviews.Author: inabag
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just got back from a 5 day, 4 night stay in Boston. We did all the normal touristy stuff, and used the T often. The Holiday Inn was within walking distance to the andrew T station. The neighborhood was alright, safe enough to walk around in if your with someone else. We ended up walking back close to midnight on both thursday and friday and had no problems whatsoever. The staff at the hotel was very nice, and we had no problems. Our room was clean, and had what we needed as tourists who wanted to spend more time out in the city then in our hotel room. Our toilet tank handle was broken and needed to be jiggled with to work, but we let them know about it. They serve complimentary breakfast everyday, which was a huge blessing for us. It is a buffet style breakfast, and they had a huge spread everyday that included eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, english muffins, bagels, french toast, fruit, muffins, cinnamon rolls, milk, juices, coffee, etc. Overall I would suggest this to anyone who wants to stay on the cheaper side in Boston, who does not mind a 10 minute walk to the T, and can get over the fact its not a 5 star hotel or a 5 star area for that matter. It served our needs, and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Magicats
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while we visted Boston and to watch a hockey game. It was very easy to get to as we drove from Ontario. While there we parked the car and utilized Boston's subway system to get into downtown and all around Boston. The Subway station was a short walk about 10 minutes or you could take the hotel's complimentary shuttle. The rooms where a comfortable size for sleeping and changing in. Best of all the rooms were very clean! Breakfast was good with the typical omellet, sausage patties, fruit...etc. Staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. We did return in the evening both nights walking from the subway and found the neighbourhood quiet. Albeit it was very cold out so not sure how quiet it would be in a warmer month. Overall this was a great place to stay if you planned to use public transportation! Would definately stay here again while in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Mars061
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights because it was way cheaper than hotels in town and because it was close to the Boston subway (T), which takes you into town for $ 1,70. We read some very negative reviews so we were pleasantly surprised to find this a wonderful place. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was clean. Our room was a bit small and didn't have the nice view someone else wrote about but that was no problem for us. The colours of the TV were a bit dark and that couldn't be fixed but big deal... The breakfast was very nice, coffee and tea were fresh all day and night, in the lobby were two computers to use for those not bringing laptops. The walk to the T station was about 5 minutes (I can imagine the neighborhood being a bit scary for a woman by herself but we never encountered anything disturbing and it really is only a short walk) and the ride into Boston was less than 10 minutes. I would definately stay here again. For those wanting to do some shopping, there's a Target, Marshalls, Old Navy and some other stores very close by (3 minute walk) and also an Applebees restaurant and a Stop and Shop. The shuttle service to the airport was very convenient too. I think we will be staying here again on our next visit to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: TimD53
Reviews.Content: This is NOT in the heart of Boston! This is in a truly bad neighborhood. We stayed here for the park and fly and had a bad experience with that as well. I highly recommend finding anything else in Boston away from here.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly fine place”
Reviews.Author: Sacro
Reviews.Content: I chanced upon the Holiday Inn Express while attempting to find a reasonably-priced room close to the new convention center in South Boston. Fortunately, I found what I was looking for and more. The facility was clean and well-cared for. My room had 1 queen-sized bed that was comfortable, room temp was fine, tv and other amenities adequate. Wireless internet was available in the lobby and the room had an ethernet connection, though it didn't work on my laptop for some reason. The free breakfast buffet was really good -- cereal, many bread products (bagels, waffles, french toast, muffins), fresh fruit, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, and juice. Most strikingly, the staff were extremely friendly, competent, and professional, even in the face of 100+ conventioneers all clamoring to get onto the 7 am morning shuttle bus (free!!) to the convention center. The motel runs a free shuttle service to and from the convention center and the airport. It's a 7-minute walk to the subway through a reasonably safe neighborhood. I would stay there again even without a convention to attend if I wanted an inexpensive and professionally-run place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Worth A Visit”
Reviews.Author: vikkiCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Holiday Inn Boston Street for 4 nights from 25 October 2007 with my husband and daughter. This was my fourth trip to Boston and my first stay in a budget hotel and to be honest I will be back!!! The hotel staff are extremely friendly and did everything they could to accomodate people. Our room was large in comparison to downtown Boston hotel rooms and while the decor was a little dated the room was spotlessly clean. We had a great view of Boston lit up by night from our room. Breakfast was provided and there was lots to choose from for both adults and children. The T is LESS than a ten minute walk and three stops to Downtown Crossing. The hotel will also organise a cab if required it only costs 10/15 dollars for a cab downtown. We rang the hotel ahead with a few queries including car hire which they were very helpful with. There was also a shuttle bus on the hour to the airport which we availed of on the way back to the airport. For a shopping trip this was an excellent base, I will return next Autumn with my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location ok”
Reviews.Author: Mary014
Reviews.Content: I was on business all week and wanted to tag a couple of days on the end and couldnt afford where I lodged all week, so I found this hotel with the review on on trip advisor. It was clean, quite pleasant and I took the subway into town in the morning and got taxis back at night. The taxi cost me $12 one evening and $18 another, so expect to pay something like that. I think if you are looking for value, then go here, it's not so far out of Boston city but personally I prefer to me more on top of things. I can't complain really though as it was clean, free breakfast and also a free transfer to the airport. Would recommend if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience - ever!”
Reviews.Author: SatireFireFly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel through travelocity because it was within walking distance to the subway which would allow for easy travel without a vehicle. That was it's ONLY positive attribute. Our room was dirty, there was visibile dust & dirt on the wall, the shower curtain was made of white cloth and looked as though it had never been taken down to be washed after it's initial hanging, the maids spoke NO english so they couldn't tell us why they skipped our room and we had to call down to the front desk to have them double back, and the staff of the hotel were uneducated and rude. When asked how to get to Salem we literally got FIVE different sets of directions, four of which were completely wrong. Our train also arrived late and so we were unable to be in town for our first night which we had prepaid for. Upon calling to advise travelocity of the situation they called the hotel (which if we would have known that's all they did we would have just called ourselves...) and were told there would be no refund. So they got all of our money for a night at the hotel that we were not there. They were also quite rude when our train finally DID arrive and we made it into town. They refused to answer questions as to why we had to pay for a night we were unable to stay when the situation was completely out of our control refusing to say anything other than, "hotel policy". They were so unhelpful and downright nasty when we called or stopped by the front desk with questions that we finally just stopped associating with them all together for the remainder of our trip. I now understand why they refuse to give refunds under any circumstances - because anyone in their right mind would demand one and never stay even a single night here. We've been stuck in this hotel for a week because we prepaid and they will not refund our money in order for us to seek better accomodations despite their "hospitality guarantee" that if something's wrong they'll make it right or you won't pay. In reality if something's wrong you'll get the 3rd degree until they begrudging come to do a half [--] fixer up and then you'll be shunned the remainder of your time at the hotel. My husband is active military so I've seen my fair share of various hotels, I've never stayed in a Holiday Inn Express before this one so I don't know if this is the rule or the exception, but I certainly will not stay at another in order to find out. I will NEVER book at a Holiday Inn Express again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for our needs”
Reviews.Author: DavyP
Reviews.Content: We had two nights in this hotel, it was adequate for our needs, beds clean, rooms fine, breakfast typically American continental i.e. waffles (cook yourself, good fun) cereals, pastries,coffee etc'. The best thing was the free airport transfers, the worst is its location, right on two motorways. There are three places within walking distance to eat, Applebees, Olive garden & one other I cant remember the name of. All in all adequate for touring as you dont spend much time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for a Boston stay”
Reviews.Author: Part_time_traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days in September, booked 2 rooms direct with the Hotel Chain website (they guarantee that's the cheapest way), about $100 a room, breakfast included. I suggest that you check out city centre hotels in Boston and see if you can get one with breakfast for less than twice that. First the only (to us) disadvantage, it's not within walking distance of the centre, and therefore meal options withing walking distance of the hotel are limited. However, cab to centre is $10 (in our case between 4 of us!), cab from airport is $10, and shuttle from hotel to airport is free and good and reliable, despite what others below might say! Breakfast buffet is good quality, plentiful, and free. T station is 15 mins walk away, but as the T is $2 per ride, for 4 of us we took a cab. Rooms are clean, well decorated and standard Holiday Inn layout. Hotel has a laundry room for guests and free internet terminals (for us non-Wifi people). Staff ranged from efficient to super helpful with directions and recommendations, special mention to Trina, who wrote out some personal recommendations for us and was always happy to give that extra help. I would suggest anyone gives this serious consideration for a Boston stay, we think it would have been hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room and location for the price”
Reviews.Author: redbird71
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for two reasons â€“ cost and proximity to a subway station to get us around town. We wanted a room that was nice, yet knowing we wouldnâ€™t be spending much time in the room. We spent approximately $130/night for 4 adults and 2 double beds non-smoking room. The hotel seemed very warm and welcoming. It looked like it was cared for. Our room was on the second floor with a window looking to the North. It looked over the roof of a restaurant but you could see downtown Boston. The room itself was clean and had nice warm tones to welcome you back after a long day of walking. Otherwise, it was standard size for two-double beds â€“ what I would expect from a Holiday Inn Express. Its location is in South Boston, just off of I-93. There was a newer shopping complex with a Home Depot just Northwest of the hotel and a restaurant adjacent to the building. In order to get to the Andrew T station (subway & bus), it was close to a 1/4 mile walk requiring us to walk around the â€œFortressâ€� building, over I-93 to Andrew Square where traffic can be tricky to navigate with 6 streets converging together. Just remember to head North on Dorchester Av. past the Dunkinâ€™ Donuts to find the station. The only problem we had with our location was one night the red line that services Andrew was shutdown due to a fire on a bridge. We were let out at the Park St. station in Boston Common with quite a distance back to the hotel. It was here when I thought it might not be a bad idea to get a hotel in the downtown area and not have to worry about something like this happening. After discussing our options (walk, bus, taxi) we waited for a shuttle bus to transport us and we got as far as the Broadway station (one stop away). From there we decided to walk down Dorchester Ave. back to the hotel. It was dark in areas as it appeared this was more of an industrial area and left me feeling a little uneasy as not many people were out, plus, the walk was a good mile or more back to the Andrew station but in the end everything worked out OK. As for amenities used, the hotel sent its shuttle to pick us up from the airport when we arrived and the standard continental breakfast suited us well for beginning our day. Overall it was a nice place to stay and I thought we did pretty well with getting a decent room and rate while staying close to downtown Boston. I would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone looking to stay at a hotel for the same reasons I wrote above.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly good for a couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: mrrfrost
Reviews.Content: About a 10 minute walk from Andrew subway station, the Holiday Inn Express is fairly convenient to get to Downtown Boston. The hotel is clean and with a pick-up service from the airport and a drop-off service to the cruise ship terminal too, it's difficult to fault the hotel too much. There was quite a lot of rowdiness on our first night - but not the hotel's fault. The breakfast is adeqaute and there is a small, antiquated gym and 2 terminals offering free internet access. And compared to the rest of Boston - good value too,

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Beat for the Money”
Reviews.Author: marysj
Reviews.Content: I agree with the majority of the reviews on this site. For Boston, this is a very reasonably priced hotel indeed - but difficult to find! You need to enter a nearby shopping mall car park in order to access the hotel. The rooms were clean and bright and the excellent breakfast took us completely by surprise. You are a 10 minute walk from the subway and then another 10 minutes away from downtown. While quite central, the location isn't great. I was nervous walking back from the subway but we had no trouble whatsoever. Best to take your meals when you are in downtown Boston. I have to say I didn't find the staff overly friendly. There was a clear problem with our room when we arrived. And although the staff did arrange for us to be moved, there was no apology whatsoever. Normally, we stay in better hotels. But this trip to New England was about economy. This hotel offers very good value for money for Boston. So if you are on a budget, you'd be hard pressed to find better - you would be looking at double the rate, at the very least, to stay in a better hotel downtown. The trade-off is the location. Would stay again if money was tight.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Boston
HotelInfo.Address: 69 Boston Street, Boston, MA 02125
